reviews.review_msg: James is extremely into the medieval times. His hair is even cut like a British fop's.  He's very enthusiastic in his teachings which is great, but tends to go seemingly o/t sometimes. A bit of a tough grader, but his assignments are easy. You NEED to read to follow his class, and especially to defend your thesis or comments in tutorial. Great guy!
they should do something about this woman all the people I know who had her said she wasn't just a bad teacher she was inappropriate and very harsh

A disgrace to SFU in general, i find it hard to believe the school still employs her, she does not help students, does not explain her marking, does not express interest in the course, and marks as though this were not an undergrad course.  Basically, if you end up with her, you will get a bad mark,

Anne is one of the greatest professors I have ever had. She is slightly scatterbrained and tends to run off-topic but she is the most knowledgable person I have ever met. She is understanding and caring and truly loves what she is doing. She gets the points across and engages the class. She is amazing.

Spring 2K5:  What a wonderful professor! Found the syllabus was lacking - a little scattered, but overall she makes the course adventurous and exciting, and she is so knowledgeable that in the end you are really glad you took Chaucer, Beowulf, etc. from her!

Well meaning lady but often got side tracked by topics that didn't have to do with the course material. For example, she spent one entire lecture showing us pictures of jesus and the virgin mary telling us that the focus is jesus' genetalia. ?!?
Anne is a great professor who seems to care a lot about the students, which is rare these days. She is very passionate about the material and is quite funny and animated. I felt she was very fair.
You people are brutal!  She was a good prof.

Had lots of organization problems because of a TA that disappeared last term and left her w/ all the marking. Despite this, she's a highly competent, well-meaning, helpful, and fair prof. Had to wait a long time for my papers, but she's still a great prof

Although I agree with what some people have said I don't really feel they are being fair.  She had a big problem with another class and she tried her hardest to get back on track.  Her enthusiam about the subject made her great.
No Comments
i agree with everything said so far - she's a joke
It'll take like a hundred years to get your papers back...and oh ...I still don't have mine :(
Worst prof I've had.  She should be sacked.
i agree..shes awful
No Comments
Brilliantly funny and unpretentious!
WHY ARE THIS GUY'S RATINGS SO HIGH?? Is he rating himself? Terrible professor. Hard marker, boring to listen to, stuck in his opinions.
I did 204 distance.  His study guide is amazing.  Anne Higgins read it to prep for her 304 class.  This guy knows medieval literature.

He is a Great Lecturer, but a rather absent minded and disorganized TA(who does mark hard), but you would be too if you had that many responsibilities. Take his classes for the simple pleasure of listening to him speak.

Knowledgable prof with strong opinions, try to express a different one and anticipate to be cut off. Pay attention and write down what she has to say b/c what you think, DOESN'T MATTER, regurgitate hers and do well. She'll turn off overhead of notes right after she's written them so don't blink.
Sheila is ****, classist and elitist. You would think this would make her very arrogant as well, but I believe that she hates herself just as much as everyone else does.
No Comments
sheila delany || grendel's mother...  did alright in the course, but loathed it.
Turns you off English - forever. Does not care about students, only about herself. Thinks that her takes are amazing, yet little is original or backed up.

She's got some great new takes on classic texts.  She deals with students who interrupt class to regurgitate what they learnt in highschool.  Her style is refreshing and she's interested in what words mean.  I'd say that's fair in an english dept.
No Comments

Fully concur w/ the comments of him wasting majority of time on mostly useless pop-culture refs and pandering to class-clown/proud bimbo types. Freq. lets discussion degenerate to nonsense. But, he means well, teaches well (when he gets around to the material) and marks and tests fairly.
if you're an English student, do anything you can to get into his class!!! enjoyable lectures, clear and fun!!!
